decision_conditions: Time Limit - 3 years

The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission, being 30/07/2019. The permission will therefore be taken to have expired on 30/07/2022, where works to commence the development shall have been undertaken.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| Approved Plans
The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

WG/S100 (Existing ground floor plan); WG/S101 (Existing roof plan); WG/S200 (Existing elevations); WG/LP100 (Site location plan / Site block plan); WG/P100 rev F (Proposed site ground floor plan); WG/P101 rev F (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); WG/P102 rev B (Proposed Lower Ground Floor Plan); WG/P103 rev C (Proposed First Floor Plan); WG/P104 rev C (Proposed Second Floor Plan); WG/P105 rev B (Proposed Roof Plan); WG/P106 rev A (Proposed Second Floor Plan with Surrounding Buildings); WG/P200 rev D (Proposed Elevations A, B and C); WG/P201 rev D (Proposed Elevations A and B); WG/P202 rev C (Proposed Elevation D); WG/P203 rev E (Proposed Elevation C North Elevation); WG/P204 rev D (Proposed Neighbours Elevation B2); WG/P300 rev E (Proposed Section AA); WG/P301 rev F (Proposed Section BB); WG/P302 rev A (Proposed Section CC); WG/L100 rev B (Proposed Landscaping Plan); WG/L101 (Proposed Front Landscaping Detail Plan); WG/L102 (Proposed Rear Landscaping Detail Plan); WG/L300 (Proposed Landscaping Section); WG/L600 (Proposed Landscaping AXO)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Materials

The materials used for the external surfaces of the development shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning permission ref: 220682CND. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded) and Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).
| Refuse and recycling store areas
Refuse and recycling storage areas shall be provided on site and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16 (superseded).
| Cycle Parking

A minimum of seventeen (17) cycle parking space shall be provided on site and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter. The cycle parking facilities shall only be used by the residents of the development hereby permitted. The residential cycle storage areas shall be secure, sheltered and adequately lit.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport in accordance with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded), Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing's Supplementary Planning Document 'Sustainable Transport for New Development' and as required by TfL and the Council's Transport Services.
| Electric Vehicle Charging Points

Prior to first use of the development hereby permitted, one car parking space shall be fitted with active vehicle charging facilities, while passive provision for the remaining three car parking space shall be provided. These spaces shall permanently be retained as such thereafter (unless they are being upgraded to active charging spaces).
Reason: To ensure appropriate infrastructure for electric or Ultra-Low Emission vehicles in accordance with London Plan Policy T6.1 and as required by the Council's Transport Services.
| Construction Method Statement
The Demolition Method Statement and Construction Management Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning permission ref: 220257CND
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan for the duration of the works.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (j) and 3.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded), Policy T3, D14 and T7 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
| Drainage Strategy

The Drainage Strategy shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning permission ref: 220682CND. No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been completed.

Reason: The development may lead to sewage flooding; to ensure that sufficient capacity is made available to cope with the new development; and in order to avoid adverse environmental impact upon the community in accordance with Policy 5.13 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded) and Policy SI13 of the London Plan (2021). | Obscure Glazed Windows

Before the development hereby permitted is brought into use, the identified obscure glazed windows on the eastern elevation as shown on approved drawings shall be obscured glazed and non-opening. The windows shall be permanently retained in that condition thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded) and Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).
| Hard and Soft Landscaping

Full details of both hard and soft landscape works, to include boundary treatment measures along the rear, side and frontages of the site; pedestrian visibility splays for the proposed parking area; grass pavers; front garden and rear garden landscaping; refuse and cycle area;  together with a 5 year management plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority and permanently retained thereafter. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.17, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded), Policies G4 and G5 of the London Plan (2021), policies 5.2, 5.4 and 6.3 of the Ealing Development Strategy DPD (2012) and policies 5.10 and 5.11 of the Development Management DPD (2013).
| Roof Terrace

Notwithstanding the five (5) terraces proposed in the drawings listed in Condition 2, no part of any roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded) and Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| Tree Protection
The Tree Protection Plan shall be implemented in full in accordance with the details approved under planning permission ref: 221701CND

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area. | Contamination

In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered during site clearance, demolition or development, no development shall continue until the following is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site. This shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

(b)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended residential use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated lands under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended residential use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approve remediation (de-contamination) scheme Part (B):

(c)	A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be completed in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination (Report: SC030114/R1)'.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, a written statement confirming this was the case shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.

In either event, all excavated soils / material must be correctly disposed of and waste transfer tickets proving correct disposal of excess waste soils has taken place shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed, any excess waste being properly disposed, and the development site is not polluted to the detriment of future workers and occupants pursuant in accordance with polices 5.21 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded); and 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Basement Construction Plan
The Basement Construction Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under planning permission ref: 221042CND.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (j) and 3.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.13, 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded), Policy D10 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
| Service Management Strategy

Prior to the first occupation of the development a Service Management Plan including details of future management, cleaning, maintaining, repairing and/or renewing of such areas of public realm and refuse servicing management arrangements shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved Servicing Management Plan shall be implemented at the first use of the development hereby permitted and shall be retained in operation thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with protection in accordance with policies 1.1 f & 2.8 g of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016) (superseded), Policies T1, T3 and T7 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission reference 181865FUL dated 29/07/2019 for 'Demolition of existing dwellinghouse and construction of a three storey plus basement residential building comprising of nine (9) flats  with associated amenity space, car parking space, refuse and cycle storage.' Variation seeks to alter the design by installation of lift, amendments to unit mix, alteration to cycle storage, bin storage, and boundary treatment. Amendments to front elevation involving single communal entrance and two private entrances and installation of balcony, reconfigured windows to rear elevation and removal of proposed terrace and amendments to basement and roof
